intro: Dorstenia tubicina f. typica, commonly known as the tubular dorstenia, is a unique member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, tubular leaves that are often curled or rolled into a spiral. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
